But it was not to be feared that, even if he were betrayed by his enemies, he would be treated in a hostile manner, leading such a life and behaviour as he was doing, or put into closer restraint than he had put himself. Yet it was very probable‚ is his secrets were known, that he might be troubled by what was worse than tortures or imprisonment‚ namely, praise and applause.
